message:
Our Managing Director, Andreas Constantinou, gives us his take on Amazon's mobile strategy:

Amazon is in the business of taking the right decisions for customers. Amazon's expertise is in converting traffic to sales, through its e-commerce properties.

For Amazon, mobile is yet another customer acquisition channel:
- Kindle Fire acquires users onto Amazon properties, and mines user profile data in and out of Amazon web sites, thanks to the Silk browser.
- Kindle apps on iOS, Android, etc acquire users onto Amazon properties

AWS is a way to subsidise the IT costs of running Amazon's e-commerce properties, in what in other industries (airlines, hotels) is referred to as yield management. AWS on mobile is simply another way for Amazon to drive usage of AWS and improve the economies of scale for its e-commerce properties.

caption: gigaom.com
message:

http://bit.ly/NQRe1Y
description: App users are a flaky group, easily discarding apps in favor of the hot new thing. But new data suggests they are developing more loyal toward apps, abandoning them less frequently and visiting their favorite apps more often, according to app analytics firm Localytics.

description: BlackBerry development may be on steep decline, but the platform still remains a profitable one for the developers that have stuck with it. According to a new study, average monthly revenue from a BlackBerry app is $3,853, compared to $3,693 for iOS and $2,735 for Android.
